alert.note: Alert for Smyth (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 28 at 7:41AM EDT until July 28 at 11:00AM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by heavy rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Virginia, including the following county, Smyth. * WHEN...Until 1000 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 739 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Blue Spring Creek, Beaver Creek, Crewey Branch, Dickey Creek, Comers Creek, Georges Branch, Comers Rock Branch, Deans Branch, Campbell Creek, Dry Creek, East Fork Hopkins Branch, Hungry Mother Creek, Cripple Creek, Dulton Branch and Houndshell Branch. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Marion... Saltville... Chilhowie... Mount Rogers National Recreation Area... Sugar Grove... Hungry Mother State Park... Adwolf... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
